title: Contains Duplicate
description: Given an integer array nums, return true if any value appears at least twice in the array, and return false if every element is distinct.

steps.explanation: We have an array [1, 2, 3, 1]. We need to check if any number appears more than once. A HashSet is perfect for this - it only stores unique values.
steps.tip: A HashSet has O(1) lookup and insertion, making it ideal for duplicate detection.

steps.explanation: Start at index 0. The number is 1. Check if 1 is already in the HashSet.
steps.code:
if nums[i] in seen:
    return True

steps.explanation: 1 is not in the HashSet (it's empty). Add 1 to the set and continue.
Move to index 1. The number is 2. Check if 2 is in the HashSet.
2 is not in the set. Add 2 and continue.
Move to index 2. The number is 3. Check if 3 is in the HashSet.
3 is not in the set. Add 3 and continue.
Move to index 3. The number is 1. Check if 1 is in the HashSet.
1 IS already in the HashSet! We found a duplicate. Return true.
steps.tip: Time complexity: O(n) - we traverse the array once. Space complexity: O(n) - we store at most n elements in the HashSet.
